author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: These sensors promise to diagnose lung cancer from breath
text:
In the future there could be important advances in the diagnosis of lung cancer. A team of researchers from Zhejiang University, in China, managed to perfect sensors capable of detecting differences in the composition of breath in particular, the decrease in the levels of the molecule called ‘isoprene’, which are the beginnings of this condition. The research was published in the pages of the magazine Ac Sensors and it arrives right in November, the month dedicated to lung cancer awareness.
Breast cancer screening, an alternative for detection in young women According to researchers, we could optimize breast cancer prevention programs taking into account the individual risk of each woman.
How do the new sensors work? The air we exhale is made up of many different molecules: there is carbon dioxide and a lot of water vapor, but also other volatile molecules, including isoprene. Previous research concluded that a decrease in isoprene levels in exhaled air could be an indication of lung cancer. However, capturing these differences is not so easy because the unit of measurement is “parts per million”; Sensitive sensors that resist breath humidity are required, and so far attempts have been poor.
According to the Chinese researchers, their indium oxide sensors can detect isoprene at levels found in human breath. The sensors are made of “nanoflakes” of platinum, indium and nickel, and are capable of detecting isoprene levels as low as 2 parts per billion. A sensitivity never achieved by other models.
Once the technical characteristics were determined, the scientists inserted the nanowire sensors into a portable detection device and performed some tests: they introduced exhaled air samples collected from 13 people; five of whom had been diagnosed with lung cancer. The device detected isoprene levels higher than 60 parts per billion in samples from healthy participants and lower than 40 parts per billion in samples from patients with the disease. The authors suggest that this technology could be a breakthrough towards non-invasive lung cancer screening and potentially save lives.
Article originally published in WIRED Italy . Adapted by Alondra Flores.
#sensors #promise #diagnose #lung #cancer #breath

author: Benita Levine
title: Thrilling Science Shows At Meadowlands Environment Center
text: Thrilling Science Shows At Meadowlands Environment Center Are you ready for an exciting adventure in science? The Meadowlands Environment Center offers thrilling science shows that will blow your mind. Imagine learning about the wonders of the natural world while having tons of fun. These shows are perfect for kids, families, and anyone curious about how things work. From explosive chemical reactions to fascinating animal behaviors, there's something for everyone. The best part? You get to see science in action, not just read about it in books. Whether you're a budding scientist or just love a good show, the Meadowlands Environment Center has something special waiting for you. Exciting Science Shows Await The Meadowlands Environment Center offers a variety of thrilling science shows that captivate audiences of all ages. These shows blend education with entertainment, making science fun and accessible. Here are some must-see science shows at the center. 1. The Wonders of Weather Weather impacts daily life in countless ways. This show dives into the science behind weather patterns, storms, and climate change. - Storm Chasers: Experience the thrill of chasing tornadoes and hurricanes through immersive simulations. - Climate Change Chronicles: Learn about the effects of global warming and what can be done to combat it. - Weather Wizards: Discover how meteorologists predict the weather using advanced technology. 2. The Mysteries of Space Space has always fascinated humans. This show takes you on a journey through the cosmos, exploring planets, stars, and galaxies. - Planetary Explorers: [Travel](https://www.touristsecrets.com/travel-tips/is-this-really-all-travel-is-about/)to different planets in our solar system and learn about their unique features. - Stellar Spectacles: Witness the birth and death of stars through stunning visual effects. - Galactic Adventures: Explore distant galaxies and understand the vastness of the universe. 3. The Marvels of Marine Life Oceans cover more than 70% of Earth's surface. This show reveals the incredible diversity of marine life and the importance of ocean conservation. - Deep Sea Discoveries: Dive into the deep ocean to uncover mysterious creatures and ecosystems. - Coral Reef Chronicles: Learn about the vibrant life in coral reefs and the threats they face. - Marine Mammal Magic: Get up close with dolphins, whales, and other marine mammals through interactive exhibits. 4. The Secrets of the Human Body The human body is a complex and fascinating machine. This show explores the inner workings of our bodies and how they keep us alive. - Brain Busters: Understand the complexities of the human brain and how it controls everything we do. - Heart Heroes: Learn about the cardiovascular system and how to keep your heart healthy. - Body Battles: Discover how the immune system fights off infections and keeps us healthy. 5. The Power of Plants Plants are essential for life on Earth. This show highlights the incredible abilities of plants and their role in the ecosystem. - Photosynthesis Phenomena: Understand how plants convert sunlight into energy through photosynthesis. - Plant Pioneers: Learn about the different types of plants and their unique adaptations. - Botanical Wonders: Explore the medicinal properties of plants and their uses in traditional medicine. 6. The Magic of Chemistry Chemistry is all around us, from the [food](https://www.touristsecrets.com/travel-guide/food-travel/the-year-in-food/) we eat to the air we breathe. This show makes chemistry exciting and accessible. - Chemical Reactions: Witness explosive reactions and learn about the science behind them. - Periodic Table Tales: Discover the elements of the periodic table and their unique properties. - Everyday Chemistry: See how chemistry impacts daily life, from cooking to cleaning. 7. The Dynamics of Earth Earth is a dynamic planet with constantly changing landscapes. This show explores the forces that shape our planet. - Volcano Ventures: Learn about the power of volcanoes and their role in shaping Earth's surface. - Earthquake Explorations: Understand the science behind earthquakes and how to stay safe during one. - Geological Journeys: Discover the history of Earth through its rocks and minerals. Experience the Excitement Thrilling science shows at Meadowlands Environment Center offer a unique blend of education and entertainment. These interactive experiences captivate audiences of all ages, making learning about science fun and engaging. From explosive chemical reactions to fascinating physics demonstrations, each show is designed to spark curiosity and inspire a love for science. Visiting the Meadowlands Environment Center provides an opportunity to witness science in action. The hands-on activities and live demonstrations make complex concepts easy to understand. Whether you're a student, teacher, or just a science enthusiast, these shows are sure to leave a lasting impression. Plan your visit to the Meadowlands Environment Center and dive into the world of science. The excitement and knowledge gained from these shows will stay with you long after you leave. Don't miss out on this thrilling educational adventure.

author: Stephanie Becerra
title: chevron-right
text: AUSTIN, Texas — Allegiant Air has announced the closure of its crew and aircraft base at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport (AUS), citing airport constraints following the planned closure of the South Terminal as the primary reason for adjustments in its base operations. "Austin is an important city in our network, and we remain committed to serving our passengers with nonstop flights from AUS," stated Allegiant Air officials. "However, due to constraints arising from the planned closure of the [South Terminal](https://cbsaustin.com/news/local/abias-south-terminal-lawsuit-settled-city-of-austin-takes-control), Allegiant will cease base operations at AUS effective January 7, 2025." The airline's decision to shutter its AUS crew and aircraft base does not signify a departure from the Austin market. Instead, Allegiant remains committed to maintaining its numerous nonstop flights from AUS, which are valued by local travelers for their convenience and affordability. Allegiant's flights will continue to operate from the South Terminal of AUS until they are eventually transitioned to the Barbara Jordan Terminal as part of ongoing airport expansion plans. This transition underscores Allegiant's dedication to serving Austin passengers while adapting to infrastructure improvements at the airport. [ALSO| ATX city council passes resolution requiring safety barriers at medical facilities](https://cbsaustin.com/news/local/atx-city-council-passes-resolution-requiring-safety-barriers-at-medical-facilities) "We appreciate the important value Allegiant Air brings to Central Texas travelers with their nonstop flight offerings," stated airport officials. "Our focus remains on providing a safe, comfortable, and authentically Austin experience for all AUS customers, regardless of their airline choice." As a consequence of the base closure, Allegiant will discontinue several routes originating from Austin. These routes include service to Santa Ana (SNA), Eugene (EUG), Bozeman (BZN), Sioux Falls (FSD), Omaha (OMA), Louisville (SDF), and Washington Dulles (IAD). The closure of Allegiant's AUS crew and aircraft base highlights the airline's strategic adjustments amidst broader industry dynamics and AUS's ongoing expansion initiatives. The airport continues to collaborate with airlines to enhance service offerings and passenger experiences. For travelers with upcoming Allegiant flights or inquiries regarding affected routes, Allegiant Air recommends contacting their customer service directly. For further updates and information regarding Allegiant Air's flight schedules and affected routes at Austin-Bergstrom International Airport, travelers are encouraged to visit Allegiant Air's official website or contact customer service directly.

author: Eric Riddle
title: 3 local restaurants receive national praise in the press
text:
SEATTLE —
LTD EDITION SUSHI
We start our food accolades tour on Seattle’s Capitol Hill at a restaurant the
New York Times named one of the top 50 in the country: Ltd Edition Sushi. They heard about the good news before they even got out of bed.
"She texted me at six in the morning," said Chef and Co-owner Keiji Tsukasaki. "She's like, 'Hey, I saw your newspaper, The New York Times.' And I was like, 'That's good, good surprise.' I didn't expect something like that."
The Times said: "The traditional preparations are superb." The small-space restaurant specializes in a pre-set, omakase-style menu which translates to, you're leaving the sushi choices up to the chef.
"Every day, we just do the two rounds. 16 people each, about 30 people every day. Just one menu. Me and Jun, our goal is to serve good fish,” Tsukasaki said.
Ltd Edition Sushi
1641 Nagle Pl Suite 006, Seattle, WA 98122
SEABIRD
Another restaurant receiving national praise is
Seabird on Bainbridge Island. Recently Bon Appetit magazine put the place in their 24 best new restaurants of 2023 list.
"They started snooping around. In the springtime, after they interviewed everyone on the staff, I wasn't sure what it was going to manifest as. I thought maybe it'd be doing a piece on Bainbridge and have like a little snippet of balance. But no, it was a huge honor,” said Chef Brendan McGill.
Bon Appetit wrote: "Chef-owner Brendan McGill's meticulously sourced menu is a heartfelt tribute to the Pacific Northwest."
"We're focused on seafood and vegetables, the most simply put. But we try to get seafood from the waters close to us. Vegetables from our farm and Bainbridge Island and Kitsap and Olympic peninsula,” said McGill. "I think it feels quintessentially Pacific Northwest here, which is awesome. That's what we're going for."
Seabird
133 Winslow Way E, Bainbridge Island, WA 98110
206-201-3789
CANLIS
Finally, awards are nothing new for Seattle fine-dining icon
Canlis. But when Aisha Ibrahim found out she was named one of Food & Wine magazines' best new chefs, the former basketball player turned cook was caught off guard.
"The editor of Food & Wine reached out and like, 'Hey, I would love to do this story on you,'” said Chef Ibrahim. "And Krusjhman's like, 'Surprise! By the way, this is not a story on Ramadan. Congratulations, you are a best new chef for Food and Wine Magazine.'"
Food & Wine wrote: "She is cultivating a thoroughly modern tasting menu and a positive kitchen culture."
"We invest a lot of our energy into people." said Ibrahim. "And it's nice to see that come back to see people like bring it and meet you in the middle, it's a gift. My team is a huge gift to me. You have to love your craft, you have to love the intentionality of everything. You have to love hospitality and have to care for guests and care for your team. And this is just kind of like icing on the cake."
CANLIS
2576 Aurora Ave N, Seattle, WA 98109
206-283-3313
[KING 5's Evening](/evening) celebrates the Northwest. Contact us:

author: Admin
title: CryptoWinrate Explores Crypto Trading Platforms: Gateway to the Cryptocurrency Market
text:
Cryptocurrency trading has become increasingly popular in recent years, with millions of individuals around the world participating in the market. One of the primary avenues for trading cryptocurrencies is through online platforms specifically designed for this purpose. These platforms provide users with the tools and resources necessary to buy, sell, and exchange various digital assets. In this article, we will explore the world of crypto trading platforms, discussing what they are, how to choose the right one, and highlighting some of the top platforms in 2024.
I. Introduction to Crypto Trading Platforms
A. Definition and Purpose
Crypto trading platforms are online marketplaces where users can trade cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Litecoin. These platforms act as intermediaries, facilitating transactions between buyers and sellers in exchange for a fee. They typically offer a range of features, including trading charts, order books, and portfolio management tools, to help users navigate the volatile cryptocurrency market.
B. Evolution of Crypto Trading Platforms
Since the inception of Bitcoin in 2009, crypto trading platforms have evolved significantly. In the early days, trading was primarily conducted through peer-to-peer networks and online forums. However, as the cryptocurrency market grew, the need for more advanced trading infrastructure became apparent, leading to the development of dedicated trading platforms.
II. Factors to Consider When Choosing a Crypto Trading Platform
A. Security Features
Security is paramount when trading cryptocurrencies online. Look for platforms that offer robust security measures such as two-factor authentication, encryption, and cold storage for funds.
B. User Interface and Experience
A user-friendly interface can make a significant difference in your trading experience. Choose a platform that is easy to navigate and offers intuitive trading tools and charts.
C. Supported Cryptocurrencies
Not all platforms support the same range of cryptocurrencies. Make sure the platform you choose supports the digital assets you are interested in trading.
D. Fees and Charges
Different platforms have varying fee structures for trades and withdrawals. Consider the fee schedule carefully to ensure it aligns with your trading strategy and budget.
E. Customer Support
In the fast-paced world of cryptocurrency trading, reliable customer support is essential. Look for platforms that offer responsive customer service channels, including live chat, email, and phone support.
Crypto trading platforms play a crucial role in facilitating access to the cryptocurrency market for traders around the world. By considering factors such as security, user experience, and supported cryptocurrencies, you can choose a
crypto trading platform that meets your trading needs.
III. Tips for Successful Crypto Trading on Platforms
A. Research and Education
Stay informed about the latest developments in the cryptocurrency market and invest time in educating yourself about trading strategies and techniques.
B. Risk Management
Only invest what you can afford to lose and diversify your portfolio to minimize risk. Set stop-loss orders to limit potential losses during volatile market conditions.
C. Setting Realistic Goals
Set achievable goals for your trading journey and avoid chasing quick profits. Remember that cryptocurrency markets can be highly volatile, and prices can fluctuate dramatically in a short period.
D. Regular Monitoring and Evaluation
Monitor your trades regularly and evaluate your trading strategy to identify areas for improvement. Stay disciplined and stick to your trading plan, even during periods of market turbulence.
One of the primary avenues for trading cryptocurrencies is through online platforms specifically designed for this purpose. These
platforms provide users with the tools and resources necessary to buy, sell, and exchange various digital assets.
IV. Conclusion
Crypto trading platforms play a crucial role in facilitating access to the cryptocurrency market for traders around the world. By considering factors such as security, user experience, and supported cryptocurrencies, you can choose a platform that meets your trading needs. Remember to conduct thorough research, practice risk management, and stay disciplined in your trading approach for long-term success.

author: @TIMESNOW
title: 'We Are Granting Him Interim Bail': SC Win For Arvind Kejriwal in Plea Challenging ED Arrest In Liquor Policy Case | Times Now
text: The Supreme Court has granted interim bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the liquor policy case. The Supreme Court has further referred the plea challenging Kejriwal's arrest to a larger bench for consideration. The verdict on Kejriwal's plea was reserved by a bench led by Justice Dipankar Datta on May 17.

author: @WIFRTV
title: A warm end to the week with rain chances Saturday
text: A warm end to the week with rain chances Saturday ROCKFORD, Ill. (WIFR) - This afternoon will feel much more like August as highs will be in the middle 80s with a good amount of sunshine. We will have a few clouds here and there, I’ll chalk it up to partly cloudy. Winds will be on the gusty side out of the southwest near 25 mph, bringing in this warm dry air. The strong wind and dry air will make it dangerous to burn outside so please avoid if you are able. Overnight tonight, a cold front will make it’s way through, shifting our winds to be out of the northeast. Clouds will stick around through the night with lows staying in the mid-50s. Winds continue to shift Saturday to be out of the east. The winds along with some cloud cover in the afternoon will give us a much more fall like day as highs top out in the upper 60s. I can’t rule out an stray shower or storm late tomorrow afternoon/evening as there will be some instability in our atmosphere. The issue with our rain chances comes down to how much moisture is in the atmosphere. It has been exceptionally dry the past few weeks and dewpoints will still be on the lower end. With this in mind any rain will be few and far between but still the chance exists. Yet another cold front will make it’s way through Saturday night which will give us a little bit better chance for showers or a rumble or two, but again we will be dry so it will be more on the scattered side. Lows overnight will bottom out in the mid-40s. Northwesterly winds will be howling Sunday as some gusts could reach 35 mph. This will lower temperatures yet again to the mid-60s. Otherwise, Sunday looks to be pretty pleasant with a few clouds here and there. Looking ahead to the start of next week, it is going to be chilly. Highs will be in the upper to middle 50s, with overnight lows near freezing. This means our first frost chances of the season are likely. Copyright 2024 WIFR. All rights reserved.

author: Redacción
title: Jeremy Sarmiento, un futbolista que provoca que “los hinchas se levanten”, asegura Carlos Corberán, DT del West Bromwich FC | Fútbol | Deportes | El Universo
text: Jeremy Sarmiento salió del Brighton y fichó por el West Bromwich Albion en busca de sumar minutos y recuperar su estado de forma. Una lesión en el metatarsiano jugando para la selección ecuatoriana, hizo que el jugador perdiera espacio en las Gaviotas y tenga que salir a buscar un nuevo club. Sin embargo, tanto para la fanaticada de los Baggies como para su entrenador, Carlos Corberán, la llegada del tricolor ha sido una de las cosas más positivas del 2023. El mediocampista ha ido incrementando su rendimiento lo que ha provado que el técnico español lo llene de elogios. [Jeremy Sarmiento sumó minutos en la victoria del West Bromwich por la Championship](https://www.eluniverso.com/deportes/futbol/jeremy-sarmiento-sumo-minutos-en-la-victoria-del-west-bromwich-por-la-championship-nota/) “Yo lo que veo en Jeremy es algo diferente. Yo veo pasión. Y amo la pasión porque uno puede manejar la pasión. Cuando algo falta, es difícil agregarlo en un jugador. Cuando hay un exceso de algo, es más fácil de manejar”, dijo el estratega en diálogo con la prensa inglesa. Publicidad [El ‘equipazo’ que no llevará Ecuador al Preolímpico 2024](https://www.eluniverso.com/deportes/futbol/el-equipazo-que-no-llevara-ecuador-al-preolimpico-2024-nota/) Desde su llegada al club de la segunda división de Inglaterra el pasado mes de julio, el volante ofensivo ya acumula 20 partidos, en los que ha convertido dos goles. Es por eso que el DT de los Throstles destaca el desarrollo que ha tenido en estos meses. “Una cosa que era importante para él es que sumara minutos, la segunda cosa importante es que rinda en la cancha. Vino aquí para que desarrollara como jugador y para poder contar con todo su talento. Y estamos en ese proceso”, destacó Corberán. 'What I see in him is something different. I see a passion. And I love the passion'— ESAlbion_star (@ESAlbion_star) [https://t.co/EyqJv4gf7o] [#Baggies] [December 20, 2023] Y las adulaciones no pararon de llegar: “Jeremy tiene ese perfil. Es un jugador que puede superar a sus rivales en el uno contra uno. Va a darse cuenta de que no es lo único que puede hacer en un partido. Hay otras cosas que debe manejar. A veces necesitas driblar y jugar a un toque”. Publicidad Por último, el valenciano de 40 años resaltó a detalle las cualidades de Sarmiento como futbolista. “Jeremy necesita jugar a un solo toque, en otras, recibir el balón, moverse y dar el pase. Estoy 100% seguro que es un jugador que hace que los hinchas se levanten de su asiento. Una de las razones por las que está aquí es para que driblee y gambetee rivales. Si gambetea a un rival, genera una chance para el equipo”, sentenció el adiestrador. (D)

author: Toni, Ramos
title: Las playas de El Saler (Valencia) se reabren al baño
text:
Medio Ambiente
Las playas de El Saler (Valencia) se reabren al baño
Fueron cerradas el martes por un vertido de fuel
El Ayuntamiento de Valencia ha reabierto al baño las playas del sur de la ciudad de Valencia, concretamente las de El Saler y Pinedo que fueron cerradas el pasado martes por un vertido de fuel proveniente de un barco. Así lo ha anunciado la alcaldesa de Valencia, María José Catalá desde la misma playa de El Saler, que ha visitado, tras dar cuenta del resultado positivo del análisis de las aguas que reflejan que son seguras para el baño.
El vertido detectado este martes en el mar y que llegó a la arena de las playas obligó a cerrar estos espacios para la retirada de la sustancia hasta este jueves, que se permitió el acceso público aunque con la bandera roja, ya que el baño no estaba permitido hasta que los análisis de las aguas han concluido que su calidad es óptima.
Un estudio preliminar apunta que el vertido contiene fuel y algunos aceites, y por esos componentes podría proceder de un buque, según avanzó la delegada del Gobierno en la Comunitat Valenciana, Pilar Bernabé, que ha pedido esperar a que el informe sea concluyente

author: VNExplorer
title: Aileen Cannon Slaps Down a Donald Trump Request
text: The main image shows former President Donald Trump speaking during his campaign rally on June 09, 2024, in Las Vegas, Nevada. The smaller image shows Judge Aileen Cannon of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida. On Thursday, Cannon rejected Trump's request for a hearing concerning omissions in the search warrant of his Mar-a-Lago estate. Judge Aileen Cannon on Thursday denied Donald Trump's motion stating that the FBI provided false or misleading information to justify the 2022 search warrant of his Mar-a-Lago home in Florida. Cannon rejected Trump's request for a Franks hearing, a legal proceeding to challenge the warrant based on claims of falsified information, because she determined his legal team had not provided sufficient evidence that the search warrant affidavit "contains any material false statements or omissions." The move affects the former president's efforts to throw out his classified documents case. Cannon also said she will hold an evidentiary hearing on Trump's attorney-client privilege, with a notice to schedule it to be issued soon. The Context Trump was indicted last June by Department of Justice special counsel Jack Smith on 40 federal charges saying that he illegally retained classified documents after leaving the White House in 2021 and obstructed the government's efforts to retrieve them. Trump's indictment came after the FBI raided his Mar-a-Lago estate in Palm Beach in August 2022. The former president has pleaded not guilty to all the charges and has said the case is politically motivated. Cannon, who was appointed by Trump in 2020, has faced criticism, largely along partisan lines, for her handling of the case, including delaying a trial and not setting a start date. What We Know In her Thursday order, Cannon wrote that Trump "identifies four omissions in the warrant, but none of the omitted information—even if added to the affidavit in support of the warrant—would have defeated a finding of probable cause." Therefore, she concluded that he did not make the requisite "substantial preliminary showing" to warrant a Franks hearing. If a Franks hearing were to occur and Cannon ruled in favor of the defense, she could throw out the evidence collected during the execution of the search warrant, which is the primary evidence in this case. That is no longer expected, given her denial of Trump's motion. While Cannon rejected Trump's motion for a Franks hearing, the judge did not throw out the aspect of Trump's motion relating to "unlawfully piercing of attorney-client privilege." She said this "cannot be resolved on the current record" and called for "an evidentiary suppression hearing" on privilege-related issues to be scheduled. Trump's legal team had requested an evidentiary hearing to challenge whether it was appropriate to break attorney-client privilege, which ensures communications between the parties remain confidential, by using the "crime-fraud exception." The exemption states that attorney-privilege does not hold for statements that are meant to further or conceal a crime. Last March, U.S. District Judge Beryl Howell ruled in favor of applying the crime-fraud exemption, allowing prosecutors to bypass attorney-client privilege and access communications between Trump and his former lawyer. The prosecution seeks to use a series of audio notes from Trump's former lawyer Evan Corcoran as evidence. On Thursday, Cannon wrote in her order that she will make her own determination on the matter. "It is the obligation of this Court to make factual findings afresh on the crime-fraud issue," she said. In addition, Cannon said the court "agrees with Defendant Trump that ambiguities persist" in the attachment to the warrant, which must comply with the Fourth Amendment. She said that those ambiguities "cannot be resolved on the current record alone" and that "further factual development is warranted." Contacted by Newsweek, the Department of Justice declined to comment. Newsweek reached out for comment to Trump lawyer Emil Bove via email. What's Next? It's not known when the next hearing will take place. Cannon will issue an order to schedule it. A trial in this case is not expected to occur before November's election. Trump is the presumptive GOP nominee in a very close contest against President Joe Biden. On Thursday night, Trump and Biden will face off in their first debate since 2020. Updated 6/27/24, 4:10 p.m. ET: This story has been updated with additional information and background. Start your unlimited Newsweek trial

organizations.name: u.s. district court for the southern district of florida
